ygData.subject: RE: Big races
ygData.msgSnippet: Something that has to be considered though is how much damage does said Troll also take (AGI and/or Dex) and what is the actual average damage. Max damage is
ygData.messageBody:
Something that has to be considered though is how much damage does said
Troll also take (AGI and/or Dex) and what is the actual average damage. Max
damage is nice but in the overal picture if the two SK's were to fight the
exact same mob (and if we were able to eliminate the randomness involved),
how would the fight end. Would the Troll do more damage and end the fight
quicker but in the process also take more damage than said DE SK..

Any ideas?



-----Original Message-----
From: Joey [mailto:demon42@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 26, 1999 4:57 PM
To: shadowknight@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [shadowknight] Big races


Actually, I am a 33rd level DE sk, and with my reaver I do between 55 and 60
max, my strength with the sword buff is only around 125 or so, now I was
grouping with a troll SK the other day, and her strength was near 200, and
she was whacking for about 80 points max, now while this is a hug
diffeerence in strength, it does show that it does count.


Tesaar Grimm
Hand of Innoruuk
The Rathe


"Steven E. Phipps" wrote:


I have yet to see any Noticable Differance from the big races to the little
races. The big races have more STR and Stamina, and have to get agility/dex
items. The smaller races gather more of the +STR items. Str and Stamina do
not seem to have any REALLY great noticable effects. I know STr affects
attack, etc.. But, has anyone noticed a level 40 ogre SK doing far greater
Damage than a level 40 DE sk? I havent.Course Troll regen is nice for
soloing, shrug. Not complaining, just STR doesnt seem to have the affect for
warrior types as it has on other muds or roleplaying games. I guess the slam
advantage is ok when your fighting casters. Not sure its worth all the
racial penalties though, heh. Least they got shrink now...8) Morgul
